title: Carousel Anything - Usage Examples
description: Parent carousel container supporting slide/fade transitions, remote control, and flexible content

examples.name: Simple Image Carousel (3 Slides)
examples.description: Basic image carousel with slide transition
examples.visualDescription: Horizontal sliding carousel with 3 image slides, smooth transitions between slides
childBlocks: Each carouselList item corresponds to one tp-anything-slide child block
tp-anything-slide blocks contain actual content (images, text, buttons, etc.)
examples.useCase: Product galleries, image showcases, photo albums
notes: carType='slide' enables horizontal sliding transition
tpgbEqualHeight=true ensures all slides have same height
_key must be unique for each slide (0, 1, 2...)
contentType='content' means slides use Gutenberg blocks

examples.name: Hero Banner Carousel with Fade Transition
examples.description: Full-width hero carousel with smooth fade effect
examples.visualDescription: Full-width hero banners that fade in/out smoothly, no sliding motion, continuous rewind from last to first slide
childBlocks: Each slide typically has heading + paragraph + button
relatedBlocks: tp-carousel-remote for prev/next buttons and dot navigation
examples.useCase: Homepage hero sections, featured promotions, announcement banners
notes: carType='fade' creates crossfade transition instead of sliding
rewindFade=true enables smooth fade when looping from last to first
carouselId connects to tp-carousel-remote for external navigation
Fade transition works best for full-width hero banners

examples.name: Testimonial Carousel with Remote Control
examples.description: Customer testimonials with external navigation controls
examples.visualDescription: Customer testimonial cards sliding horizontally, controlled by separate prev/next buttons and dot indicators placed outside carousel
childBlocks: Or custom layout: image + quote + name + rating
relatedBlocks: tp-carousel-remote can be placed anywhere on page (above, below, sidebar)
examples.useCase: Customer testimonials, client reviews, case studies, success stories
notes: carouselId='testimonial-carousel' must match tp-carousel-remote's carouselId
equalUnqClass provides unique identifier for equal height calculation
tpgbEqualHeight ensures all testimonial cards have same height
Remote control allows flexible positioning of navigation elements

examples.name: Product Showcase with Overflow Hidden
examples.description: Product carousel with clipped overflow for clean edges
examples.visualDescription: Product cards sliding horizontally, overflow hidden so only visible slides show, creates clean edge cutoff for partial slides
childBlocks: tp-anything-slide with product image, title, price, add-to-cart button
examples.useCase: E-commerce product carousels, featured products, related items, upsells
notes: OverflowHid=true hides slides outside viewport (clean edges)
Without OverflowHid, partial slides peek on edges
Use OverflowHid for professional, contained carousel look
Typically shows 3-4 products at a time on desktop

examples.name: Random Order Content Slider
examples.description: Feature carousel with randomized slide order on page load
examples.visualDescription: Feature highlights in random order each time page loads, keeping content fresh and dynamic
childBlocks: tp-anything-slide with feature icon, heading, description
examples.useCase: Feature highlights, service showcases, rotating promotions, dynamic content
notes: rmdOrder=true randomizes slide order on each page load
Great for showcasing different features to different visitors
Keeps content feeling fresh even with static slides
Order changes client-side (not cached)

examples.name: Template-Based Carousel
examples.description: Carousel using saved block templates for slide content
examples.visualDescription: Carousel where each slide loads content from a saved WordPress block template/pattern
childBlocks: tp-anything-slide blocks load content from saved templates
examples.useCase: Reusable slide layouts, CMS-managed content, multi-site carousels with shared templates
notes: caroslideType='template' enables template mode
blockTemp is the template ID from WordPress
contentType='template' for each slide using templates
backendVisi=true shows template preview in editor
Templates can be managed separately and reused across carousels

examples.name: Equal Height Carousel with Custom Class
examples.description: Multi-slide carousel with equal height and custom JavaScript hooks
examples.visualDescription: Card-based carousel where all cards maintain equal height even with varying content, custom class for JavaScript targeting

carouselList.title: Blog Post 3 - Long Content with Multiple Paragraphs

childBlocks: tp-anything-slide with blog post excerpt, featured image, read more button
examples.useCase: Blog post carousels, news feeds, article showcases, content grids
notes: tpgbEqualHeight=true ensures all slides have same height
equalUnqClass='custom-carousel-eq-height' provides unique class for targeting
Equal height prevents layout shifts when slides have different content length
Custom class useful for additional JavaScript functionality or CSS styling

examples.name: Complete Carousel with All Features
examples.visualDescription: Professional carousel with fade transitions, equal height slides, remote control connection, overflow hidden, custom unique class for advanced customization
childBlocks: tp-anything-slide with complex layouts (container + row + columns)
Each slide can have unique design while maintaining equal height
relatedBlocks: tp-carousel-remote can show prev/next buttons, dot indicators, and pagination (1/5)
examples.useCase: Premium showcases, portfolio highlights, case study carousels, feature comparisons
notes: Combines all carousel features for maximum flexibility
carType='fade' + rewindFade=true for smooth continuous fading
OverflowHid=true for clean edges
tpgbEqualHeight=true + equalUnqClass for equal height calculations
carouselId connects to external navigation controls
showBlockContent=true ensures slides are visible (set false to hide)

carTypeGuide.fade: Crossfade transition (best for hero banners, full-width slides)

contentTypeGuide.content: Slides use Gutenberg blocks (tp-anything-slide child blocks)
contentTypeGuide.template: Slides load from saved WordPress block templates

carouselListStructure._key: Unique identifier (0, 1, 2...), must be unique per slide
carouselListStructure.title: Slide title (for reference, not displayed)
carouselListStructure.blockTemp: Template ID (when contentType='template'), 'none' for content mode
carouselListStructure.backendVisi: true to show template preview in editor, false to hide

equalHeightSystem.tpgbEqualHeight: Enable equal height calculation across all slides
equalHeightSystem.equalUnqClass: Custom class for unique equal height group (multiple carousels on page)
equalHeightSystem.recommended: Always use tpgbEqualHeight=true for card-based carousels

remoteControlConnection.setup: Set carouselId on carousel, match it in tp-carousel-remote block
remoteControlConnection.flexibility: Remote can be placed anywhere (above, below, sidebar, fixed position)

validationRules.carouselList: Required, minimum 1 slide (array of slide objects)
validationRules.carouselList._key: Required for each slide, must be unique (use 0, 1, 2...)
validationRules.carouselList.title: Required for each slide (reference only)
validationRules.carouselList.blockTemp: Required when contentType='template', must be valid template ID
validationRules.carouselId: Optional, but required if using tp-carousel-remote
validationRules.equalUnqClass: Optional, recommended when tpgbEqualHeight=true and multiple carousels on page
validationRules.caroslideType: Optional, defaults to 'template' (set 'content' for Gutenberg blocks)

warnings: CRITICAL: Each slide's _key must be unique (use sequential numbers: 0, 1, 2, 3...)
CRITICAL: carouselId must match exactly in both tp-anything-carousel and tp-carousel-remote
Don't mix contentType values in same carousel (all 'content' or all 'template', not both)
rewindFade only works when carType='fade' (ignored for slide type)
tpgbEqualHeight requires JavaScript, ensure equal height script is loaded
equalUnqClass is case-sensitive, use same exact string in related CSS/JS
Minimum 1 slide required in carouselList, recommended 3+ for carousel effect
OverflowHid=true can clip navigation arrows if positioned inside carousel
rmdOrder randomizes on page load (not cached, changes each visit)
Template mode requires valid template IDs that exist in WordPress
backendVisi=true can slow editor performance with many slides (use false for production)
Large number of slides (20+) can impact performance, consider pagination
When using fade transition, ensure slides have same dimensions for smooth effect
Remote control requires carouselId to be set on carousel first
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set unique _key for each slide (causes duplicate key errors)
Setting carouselId on remote but not on carousel (remote won't connect)
Using different carouselId values (typo causes remote to not work)
Setting tpgbEqualHeight=true without understanding equal height applies to ALL slides
Using OverflowHid=true and wondering why navigation arrows are clipped
Setting rewindFade=true on carType='slide' (has no effect)
Mixing contentType='content' and 'template' in same carousel (causes rendering issues)
Not setting equalUnqClass when multiple carousels on page with tpgbEqualHeight=true (all carousels share same equal height calculation)
Using rmdOrder=true and expecting consistent order (order changes each page load)
Setting backendVisi=true for all slides in large carousels (editor becomes slow)
Creating carousel with only 1 slide (technically works but pointless)
Deleting slides without updating remaining _key values (can cause gaps)
Not testing fade transition with different slide heights (looks bad)
Setting showBlockContent=false and wondering why carousel is empty
bestPractices: Always use sequential _key values (0, 1, 2, 3...) for clarity
Set tpgbEqualHeight=true for card-based layouts (testimonials, products, blog posts)
Use equalUnqClass when multiple carousels on same page to isolate equal height calculations
Set carouselId even if not using remote initially (easier to add navigation later)
Use descriptive carouselId values (e.g., 'product-carousel', 'testimonial-slider')
For hero banners, use carType='fade' + rewindFade=true for smooth continuous loop
For product/content carousels, use carType='slide' for horizontal sliding
Set OverflowHid=true for clean, professional carousel edges
Set OverflowHid=false if navigation arrows are positioned inside carousel
Use rmdOrder=true for content that benefits from randomization (features, testimonials)
Use contentType='content' for custom slide layouts (most common)
Use contentType='template' for reusable slide layouts across multiple carousels
Set backendVisi=false for better editor performance (preview slides individually)
Aim for 3-6 slides for optimal user experience (not too few, not overwhelming)
For product carousels, show 3-4 products on desktop, 2 on tablet, 1 on mobile
Test carousel with varying content lengths to ensure equal height works correctly
Always pair carousel with tp-carousel-remote for better UX (prev/next/dots)
Use descriptive slide titles for easier content management
Keep slide content concise (long content doesn't work well in carousels)
Consider accessibility: ensure keyboard navigation works, add ARIA labels to remote
accessibilityNotes: Use tp-carousel-remote with proper ARIA labels (pAriaLabel, nAriaLabel)
Ensure slides are keyboard accessible (tab through interactive elements)
Don't rely solely on carousel navigation (users may miss content)
Provide alternative access to carousel content (e.g., 'View All' link)
Test with screen readers (ensure slides are announced correctly)
Use semantic HTML in slide content (headings, paragraphs, buttons)
Ensure sufficient color contrast in slide content (WCAG 2.1 AA minimum)
Don't auto-play carousels (annoying for screen reader users)
Provide pause/play controls if carousel auto-advances
Ensure touch gestures work on mobile (swipe to navigate)
Test keyboard navigation (arrow keys, tab, enter)
Add visible focus indicators to interactive elements
Ensure carousel doesn't trap keyboard focus
Use descriptive link text in slides (avoid 'Read More', use 'Read More About X')
performanceConsiderations: Lazy load images in slides (especially for product carousels with many images)
Set backendVisi=false to improve editor performance
Limit slides to 20 or fewer for optimal performance
Use optimized images (WebP format, appropriate dimensions)
Avoid heavy animations in slide content (conflicts with carousel transitions)
Consider pagination for very large datasets (instead of 50+ slide carousel)
Test on mobile devices (carousels can be resource-intensive)
Avoid nested carousels (carousel inside carousel causes performance issues)
Use content='content' instead of 'template' when possible (templates add overhead)
Cache carousel HTML when using template mode
